intro: Gustavia poeppigiana, commonly known as the white hibiscus, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has heart-shaped, dark green leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Gustavia poeppigiana is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
